basics.name: Shaelyn Loo
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Aloha! My name is Shaelyn Loo and I am a student in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I am studying to get a B.S. in Computer Science on the Data Science Track and am expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
education.area: Computer Science in the Data Science Track (expected Spring, 2026)

education.studyType: High School Diploma with Academic Honors

work.company: University of Hawaii Office of Indigenous Knowledge and Innovation
highlights: Assist in designing and developing hub research projects related to the Indigenous Data Hubs
Attend and participate in weekly meetings and development workshops
Meet with and discuss design plans with community partners
Design and brainstorm different iterations of the research projects
Present in an Indigenous Data Hub symposium at the end of each semester
Independently develop techincal data science coding skills
Meet with graduate mentors and discuss progression of individual research project
Researched project topic and applied data science skills to deepen understanding
Researched appropriate datasets regarding decided topic to then be cleaned and processed
Presented research findings at the conclusion of the program

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa College of Engineering
highlights: Assisted the College of Engineering in the Dean’s office with preparing and working events for the College
Answered phone calls and questions about the college, assisted office staff with updating electronic files, processed mail, and provided customer service
Worked with IT staff and Internship Coordinator to redesign the Kamehameha Internships website and created an Instagram page while upholding school IT safety protocols
Worked independently to meet deadlines in a timely manner and complete tasks
Created graphics, social media posts, and blog posts for the company to upload on their website
Worked independently to research content and design a functioning website
Attended client meetings and took minutes
Performed other office tasks as assigned
Assisted with organizing the Great Teachers event hosted by LCC
Contacted and communicated with LCC staff

awards.title: Provost Scholar
awards.summary: A scholarship awarded to incoming freshmen to recognize and celebrate the academic strengths and demonstrated community impact of students who enroll at UH Mānoa the semester after the completion of their high school diploma. Student must be full-time and maintain a 3.0 GPA.

awards.title: Inaugural Lau Maiʻa Scholar for Native Hawaiians in Tech
awards.summary: Awarded to graduating high school seniors who are attending a 4-year college and majoring in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or Entrepreneurship and are committed to serving the ʻāina, kaiāulu, lāhui.

awards.title: CNS Native Hawaiian Scholarship
awards.awarder: College of Natural Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa
awards.summary: Awarded to Native Hawaiian students studying in any discipline in the College of Natural Sciences. Student must be full-time and maintain a 3.0 GPA.

awards.title: Ka’i Lanakila Scholarship
awards.summary:
Awarded to students pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, Associate’s degree, or a
Certificate through an eligible program as identified by Kamehameha Schools. Student must be full-time and maintain a 3.0 GPA.

awards.title: Lela Robinson Brewer Award
awards.summary:
Award is presented by each teacher to the most outstanding student in their
class for the school year based on academic performance and attitude.

awards.title: Ka Lei o ka Lanakila
awards.summary: Award is presented to the top 10% of students in the grade level.
